indications: Indications urinary retention, but see notes above
name: BETHANECHOL CHLORIDE
cautions:
Cautions autonomic neuropathy (use lower initial
dose); interactions: Appendix 1 (parasympathomimetics)
side-effects:
Side-effects nausea, vomiting, diarrhoea, abdominal pain, increased
salivation, eructation; flushing, hypotension, bradycardia; bronchoconstriction,
rhinorrhoea; headache; increased lacrimation; increased sweating
doses: 10–25 mg 3–4 times daily half an hour before food
pregnancy: Pregnancy manufacturer advises avoid—no information available
